questions.question: The response of a system can be reduced by use of isolators and absorbers

explanations.a: Correct, the rigth answer is (a). Isolators are devices that mechanically decouple a system from its surroundings. They reduce the transmission of vibrations or shocks from one part of the system to another. Vibration absorbers, such as tuned mass dampers or tuned liquid dampers, absorb energy from the system’s vibrations. They work by introducing an out-of-phase vibration that cancels the original vibration, effectively reducing its amplitude.
